peer.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc
peer.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
Staff members are trained by their peers.
peer.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a member of the British nobility
peer.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to look very carefully at something, especially because you are having difficulty seeing it
peer.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He was peering through the wet windscreen at the cars ahead.
peer.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a company or product that is similar to the one you are talking about
peer.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: He believes the company is undervalued relative to its peers.
peer.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: someone who is the same age or has the same job, social position etc as the person you are talking about
peer.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Staff members are trained by their peers.
